|budget = $16 million (2008) |website = [http://astrobiology.nasa.gov
astrobiology.nasa.gov] |remarks = }} The 'NASA Astrobiology Institute' (NAI) was
established in 1998 by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration
(NASA) "to develop the field of astrobiology and provide
a scientific framework for flight missions". The NAI is
a virtual, distributed organization that integrates astrobiology
research and training programs in concert with the national and international
science communities. Since 2006, the director of the
institute has been Carl Pilcher.
